hints_html: Pay attention to the order of composition!
hints_latex: Pay attention to the order of composition!
hints_raw: Pay attention to the order of composition!
question: 1 (d)
sols_html:
Since the composition \(\alpha \circ \beta\) is given by doing \(\beta\) first and then \(\alpha\), we must have that

\[\begin{aligned} 1 \mapsto 2 \mapsto 3 \\ 2 \mapsto 1 \mapsto 2 \\ 3 \mapsto 3 \mapsto 4 \\ 4 \mapsto 4 \mapsto 1\end{aligned}\]

and so we have that \(\alpha \circ \beta\) is given by

\[\begin{aligned} \alpha \circ \beta = \begin{pmatrix}1 & 2 & 3 & 4 \\ 3 & 2 & 4 & 1 \end{pmatrix}\end{aligned}\]
sols_raw:
Since the composition <math>\alpha \circ \beta</math> is given by doing <math>\beta</math> first and then <math>\alpha</math>, we must have that

:<math>\begin{align}
1 \mapsto 2 \mapsto 3 \\
2 \mapsto 1 \mapsto 2 \\
3 \mapsto 3 \mapsto 4 \\
4 \mapsto 4 \mapsto 1
\end{align}</math>

and so we have that <math>\alpha \circ \beta</math> is given by

:<math>\alpha \circ \beta = \begin{pmatrix}1 & 2 & 3 & 4 \\ 3 & 2 & 4 & 1 \end{pmatrix}</math>
statement_html:
Let

\[\begin{aligned} \alpha = \begin{pmatrix} 1 & 2 & 3 & 4 \\ 2 & 3 & 4 & 1 \end{pmatrix}\end{aligned}\]

and

\[\begin{aligned} \beta = \begin{pmatrix} 1 & 2 & 3 & 4 \\ 2 & 1 & 3 & 4 \end{pmatrix}\end{aligned}\]

be two permutations of {1, 2, 3, 4}. Find the composition \(\alpha \circ \beta\).
statement_raw:
Let 
:<math>
\alpha = \begin{pmatrix} 1 & 2 & 3 & 4 \\ 2 & 3 & 4 & 1 \end{pmatrix}
</math>
and
:<math>
\beta = \begin{pmatrix} 1 & 2 & 3 & 4 \\ 2 & 1 & 3 & 4 \end{pmatrix}
</math>
be two permutations of {1, 2, 3, 4}. Find the composition <math> \alpha \circ \beta</math>.
